docs.snippet: Acting under intense military pressure, President Juan Marfa Bordaberry and two Cabinet members abolished the Congress today, ending constitutional Government in this republic for the first time in 40 years.
docs.lead_paragraph: Acting under intense military pressure, President Juan Marfa Bordaberry and two Cabinet members abolished the Congress today, ending constitutional Government in this republic for the first time in 40 years.

headline.main: URUGUAY DECREES END OF CONGRESS; Constitutional Government Ended by Leader, Under Pressure by Military

docs.snippet: President Juan Maria Bordaberry, who closed down Parliament yesterday in a move backed by the military, today dissolved Uruguay's 19 municipal councils.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Juan Maria Bordaberry, who closed down Parliament yesterday in a move backed by the military, today dissolved Uruguay's 19 municipal councils.
docs.abstract: Pres J M Bordaberry, who on June 27 closed down Uruguay's Cong, dissolves nation's munic councils on June 28 and says they will be replaced by boards of appointees under direct control of Govt; gen strike, which Natl Labor Confederation called after troops occupied Cong bldg, paralyzes nation's major indus; Montevideo Univ students boycott classes and no newspapers are published; in broadcast, Bordaberry says he is planning new crackdown on subversives, especially Tupamaros

headline.main: Uruguayan Chief Acts to Widen Uontrol

docs.snippet: The prompt crushing by loyalist forces of an armored regiment's rebellion against President Allende in Chile is a cause for great relief. Chile has drifted into difficult and dangerous times under Dr. Allende's Marxist-domi nated Government; but a...
docs.lead_paragraph: The prompt crushing by loyalist forces of an armored regiment's rebellion against President Allende in Chile is a cause for great relief. Chile has drifted into difficult and dangerous times under Dr. Allende's Marxist-domi nated Government; but a military takeover would only make things worse, raising prospects of civil war in addition to destroying one of the few remaining democratic systems in Latin America.
docs.abstract: ed scoring closing of Cong in Uruguay by Pres J M Bordaberry; says present virtual control of country by mil stems from Bordaberry's mistake of unleashing them against Tupamaro urban guerrillas

headline.main: A Coup Aborted...; ... but a Democracy Dead

docs.snippet: With gasoline and food running short, Presi dent Juan Maria Bordaberry sought today to end a general strike called in protest against the end of constitutional government here.
docs.lead_paragraph: With gasoline and food running short, Presi dent Juan Maria Bordaberry sought today to end a general strike called in protest against the end of constitutional government here.
docs.abstract: Pres J M Bordaberry convenes Natl Security Council on June 29 in attempt to end gen strike called by leftist Natl Workers Conv; strike has shut down whole country; mil sorces say mil presence on council means troops could be used to end strikes

headline.main: URUGUAY SEEKS END OF GENERAL STRIKE

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON - Nearly four years ago, Senator Charles E. Goodell, a New York Republican whom the Nixon administration subsequently helped to defeat at the polls, proposed what was then a novel piece of legislation.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON - Nearly four years ago, Senator Charles E. Goodell, a New York Republican whom the Nixon administration subsequently helped to defeat at the polls, proposed what was then a novel piece of legislation.
docs.abstract: comment on uneasiness among W Eurs over Nixon-Brezhnev confs and W Eur relations with US in this period of shifting world relations

docs.snippet: The Uruguayan Government used armed troops today to break up a general strike protesting against the closing of Congress, and it ordered the country's largest labor organization disbanded and its leaders arrested.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Uruguayan Government used armed troops today to break up a general strike protesting against the closing of Congress, and it ordered the country's largest labor organization disbanded and its leaders arrested.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Govt on June 30 sends troops to break up gen strike called by National Workers Conf; conf says 400,000 workers are participating in strike which has left Montevideo with little food or fuel; police, marines and army units clear factories, banks, public offices and refineries that workers have been occupying; Govt also disbands labor coalition, confiscates its property and says it will submit all union leaders and members who participated in strike to criminal justice; coalition source says that orgn has emergency plans for such a situation and its leadership will function underground; strike was called to protest Pres Bordaberry's closing of Cong on June 27 after it had refused to impeach leftist Sen E Erro, whom mil accuses of having contacts with Tupamaro urban guerrillas

headline.main: Uruguay's A rmy and Policemen Move to Break General Strike; Property to Be Seized

docs.snippet: Most of Uruguay's workers refused today to end a five-day general strike, presenting President Juan Maria Bordaberry's military-backed regime with serious problems.
docs.lead_paragraph: Most of Uruguay's workers refused today to end a five-day general strike, presenting President Juan Maria Bordaberry's military-backed regime with serious problems.
docs.abstract: most of Uruguay's workers refuse to end 5-day gen strike called June 28 to protest Pres Bordaberry's closing of Cong; Govt was able to clear some of bldgs occupied by workers, has some transportation back in service and has averted a fuel shortage by sending troops into Uruguay's only oil refinery; workers continue campaign of passive resistance and remain idle; opposition groups, Blanco party and left-wing Broad Front coalition join ranks to demand Bordaberry's resignation and restoration of constitutional govt; liberal groups in armed forces and members of Bordaberry's own Colorado party are reptd rallying with regime's opponents; spokesman for combined opposition says strikers have its unconditional support; calls for provisional govt that would include members of armed forces, all pol parties and workers' reprs; bloc says it plans to take Pres before Sup Ct for violating const

headline.main: Uruguayan Workers Defy Army And Continue a General Strike

docs.snippet: Who would have thought that unknown Alex Mayer would be in the semifinals at Wimbledon. He exploded into the head lines last Saturday when he upset top-seeded Ilie Nastase of Rumania, supposedly a certainWimbledon winner.
docs.lead_paragraph: Who would have thought that unknown Alex Mayer would be in the semifinals at Wimbledon. He exploded into the head lines last Saturday when he upset top-seeded Ilie Nastase of Rumania, supposedly a certainWimbledon winner.

headline.main: Mayer Gains Semifinals; Metreveli Beats Connors; MAYER ADVANCES; CONNORS BEATEN

docs.snippet: White House officials announced that Henry A. Kissinger will go to Peking in late July or early August to confer with Pre mier Chou En-lai. The trip will be on the agenda when Huang Chen, head of the Chinese liaison office in Washington, meets with...
docs.lead_paragraph: White House officials announced that Henry A. Kissinger will go to Peking in late July or early August to confer with Pre mier Chou En-lai. The trip will be on the agenda when Huang Chen, head of the Chinese liaison office in Washington, meets with President Nixon in San Clemente, Calif.,tomorrow.

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day International Metropolitan National The Other News Quotation of the Day

docs.snippet: White House officials announced that Henry A. Kissinger will go to Peking in late July or early August to confer with Premier Chou En-lai. The trip will be on the agenda when Huang Chen, head of the Chinese liaison office in Washington, meets with...
docs.lead_paragraph: White House officials announced that Henry A. Kissinger will go to Peking in late July or early August to confer with Premier Chou En-lai. The trip will be on the agenda when Huang Chen, head of the Chinese liaison office in Washington, meets with President Nixon in San Clemente, Calif., tomorrow.
